AL.notes: Visa required; except with valid multi entry visa issued by United States, United Kingdom or an EU Member State, used at least once prior arrival, then max 90 days.[citation needed]

AD.notes:
Andorra has no visa regime; only accessible through France and Spain.
Valid multi entry visa issued by an EU Member State is required.[citation needed]

AO.notes: Visa required; except by confirming visa approved prior departure, then visa on arrival.[citation needed]

AG.notes:
Visa on arrival for 90 days with valid visa or PR card for United States, Canada, United Kingdom or an EU Member State.[citation needed]
E-visas can be obtained before departure at www.immigration.gov.ag. Passengers must have a printed e-visa confirmation.

AU.notes: May obtain visa through an online process (Online Visitor e600 visa).

AZ.notes:
eVisa holder  can enter Azerbaijan at any border entry point
Visa on arrival is available at any international airport.

BS.notes: 90 days with valid US/UK visa.[citation needed]

BZ.notes: Visa on arrival for 90 days with valid Schengen or multi entry US visa.[citation needed]

BJ.notes: Must have an international vaccination certificate.

BO.notes: Available at Cochabamba, La Paz and Santa Cruz airports.[citation needed]

BA.notes: 30 days with a valid multiple entry visa from an EU, Schengen State, or USA.[citation needed]

BG.notes: 90 days in any 6-month period for Schengen visa holders.

KH.notes:
E-visas can be obtained before departure at https://www.evisa.gov.kh/.
Nationals of Iran can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 30 days. They must have a passport with at least 1 unused visa page and a passport photo. They can apply to extend their stay.

CN.notes: Visas issued outside of Iran/China require residence/work permit. Special Economic Zone (SEZ) visa on arrival is available for Zhuhai/Xiamen for 3 days.[citation needed]

CR.notes: 30 days with multi entry US/Canada visa.[citation needed]

HR.notes: Visa required; except for holders of valid multi entry Schengen visa, used at least once prior arrival, then max 90 days.[citation needed]

CY.notes: Visa required; except for holders of valid multi entry Schengen visa, used at least once prior arrival, then max 90 days.[citation needed]

EG.notes: Entry visas must be endorsed by Security Approval from Security of State.

ET.notes: eVisa holders must arrive via Addis Ababa Bole International Airport.

GA.notes: eVisa holders must arrive at Libreville International Airport.[citation needed]

GY.notes: 30 days for holders of sponsor/host invite letter.[citation needed]

IN.notes:
e-Visa holders must arrive via 26 designated airports or 3 designated seaports.
An Indian e-Tourist Visa can only be obtained twice in one calendar year.

IQ.notes: Issued free of charge in Iraqi's embassies or consulates.

IL.notes: Confirmation from Israeli government is required before a visa is issued.

JO.notes: Normal passport holders must obtain security approval prior to arrival.[citation needed]

KZ.notes: Visa free for tourist groups of 5-50.

KG.notes:
Electronic visa holders must arrive via Manas International Airport or Osh Airport or through land crossings with China (at Irkeshtam and Torugart), Kazakhstan (at Ak-jol, Ak-Tilek, Chaldybar, Chon-Kapka), Tajikistan (at Bor-Dobo, Kulundu, Kyzyl-Bel) and Uzbekistan (at Dostuk).
Reciprocal visa-free scheme agreed.

LB.notes:
Extendable for 2 months
Free at Beirut International Airport or any other entry port (no Israeli visa/seal, hold a phone number, Lebanese address, non-refundable return/circle ticket).[citation needed]
Passports of Iranian travellers entering Lebanon will not be stamped

MR.notes: Available at Nouakchott–Oumtounsy International Airport[citation needed]

MX.notes: Visa required; except with valid visa issued by Canada, Japan, United States, United Kingdom or an EU Member State, then max 180 days.

NZ.notes: May obtain visa through an online process.

MK.notes: Visa required; except for holders of valid multi entry Schengen visa, used at least once prior arrival, then max 15 days.[citation needed]

PK.notes:
Online Visa eligible.
Electronic Travel Authorization to obtain a visa on arrival for business purposes.

PA.notes: 30 days with a valid Australia/Canada/US/UK visa.[citation needed]

RO.notes: Visa required; except with valid multi entry Schengen visa, used at least once prior arrival, then max 90 days.[citation needed]

RU.notes:
eVisa for up to 8 days for Amur Oblast, Chukotka, Kamchatka, Khabarovsk Krai, Primorye and Sakhalin regions of the Russian Far East for tourism, business and humanitarian purposes. Available at 6 airports, 5 seaports, some railway and road entry points.
15 day visa waiver for tourist groups of 5-50 was signed in March 2017 and is yet to be ratified.

SC.allowed_stay: Three months, with extensions up to twelve months.
SC.notes: All foreign nationals visiting Seychelles are granted visa free access. They must be in a possession of a valid passport, return or onward ticket, proof of accommodation and sufficient funds. The Visitor’s Permit is issued free of charge and is initially valid for up to three months but it can be extended for a fee for a period of up to three months with further extensions not exceeding total period of twelve months.

SG.notes: Simplified application online through the 'Submission of Application for Visa Electronically' (SAVE) system.[citation needed]

SO.notes: Available at Bosaso Airport, Galcaio Airport and Mogadishu Airport.[citation needed]

ZA.notes: Negotiations are being finalized to conclude Visa Waiver Agreements for Iranian ordinary passport holders.

SY.notes: IATA states 90 day visa issued on arrival;  deputy foreign minister states bilateral visa free regime. But Law No.2 of 2014 states all visitors require a visa prior to arrival.

AE.notes: Free transit visa at DXB - Up to 96 hours

US.notes: Suspended issuance of immigrant and non-immigrant visas except F, M and J visas.

UY.notes: Prior authorisation required before issuing visa.

IO.notes: The British Indian Ocean Territory is not a tourist destination. Access is restricted and a permit is required in advance of travel. There are no commercial flights and permits for yachts are only issued to allow safe passage through the Indian Ocean (Outer Islands only). Access to Diego Garcia is only permitted to those with connections either to the military facility or to the Territory’s Administration.

CK.allowed_stay: Periods of 31 days, up to a maximum of 6 months
CK.notes: All visitors to the Cook Islands, irrespective of nationality, are visa-exempt for a maximum stay of 31 days. Visitors travelling for tourist purposes may extend their stay, for periods of 31 days, up to a maximum of 6 months.

NU.notes: Except for nationals of New Zealand who are Niueans or descendants of Niueans, visas are required by all nationalities except for bona fide visitors staying 30 days or less. Visitors must have sufficient funds for the length of their stay together with a confirmed reservation for accommodation and those not holding return or onward tickets could be refused entry. Extensions of stay are possible.

GS.notes: The Commissioner of South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands, based in Stanley, regulates all access to the territory. Visas are not required, but all visitors irrespective of their nationality or mode of transport must apply to the Commissioner for permission to land in advance. The visit permit is issued to a 'permit holder', normally a cruise vessel expedition leader or a yacht master. Visitors travelling to South Georgia as paying passengers on cruise ships and yachts do not need to submit a visit application.

SJ.notes: Uniquely, the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard is an entirely visa-free zone. Everybody may live and work in Svalbard indefinitely regardless of country of citizenship.

TK.notes: All visitors must obtain a permit to enter Tokelau from the Tokelau Apia Liaison Office in Apia, at least 2 weeks prior to travel. Tokelau can only be reached by boat from Samoa and a permit from the Samoan Immigration Authorities is required to leave and re-enter Samoa.
